case.name: Minister for Immigration and Citizenship v SZKJT [2009] FCA 984 (31 August 2009)

citphrases.citphrase: whether tribunal made jurisdictional error by inviting a person to give tribunal additional information under s 424(2) of migration act 1958 (cth) (the act) without complying with s 424(3) 's requirement that the invitation be given in writing by one of the methods specified in s 441a of the act
circumstances in which s 424(2) is activated.
non-compliance with statutory code of procedure
whether failure to comply with section 424 gives rise to jurisdictional error
the obligation to give a written invitation to a person to provide additional information is mandatory
whether failure to provide 'information' involved a breach of section 424a
'information' relevant to the review by the rrt which might be used to decide matters adversely to the appellant
an earlier decision of the full court on similar issues should be followed unless 'plainly wrong'
decision in szkti v minister for immigration and citizenship not 'plainly wrong' but correct
refugee review tribunal telephoned a person to obtain information about appellant
procedures for obtaining such information in ss 424(2) , (3) and 424b of the migration act 1958 (cth) not followed
refugee review tribunal telephoned a person to obtain information about appellant
whether telephone call raised new "issues arising in relation to the decision under review" under s 425(1) of the migration act 1958 (cth)
whether tribunal therefore required to invite appellant to a new hearing.
szbel v minister for immigration and multicultural and indigenous affairs immigration
appellant claimed he feared persecution on basis of his conversion to christianity if returned to iran
delegate of the first respondent refused to grant appellant protection visa because not satisfied of the genuineness of appellant's conversion to christianity
appellant invited by tribunal to give evidence relating to the issues arising in relation to the decision under review
appellant gave evidence addressed to the delegate's concern regarding the genuineness of his conversion to christianity
tribunal affirmed the delegate's decision not to grant a protection visa on the basis that appellant's claims were not credible
whether tribunal failed to notify the appellant adequately of the issues to which its reasoning processes were directed
whether failure of tribunal to ask the appellant to address issues that it considered might be important amounted to a denial of procedural fairness.
review of decision of refugee review tribunal
weight given to evidence a matter for the tribunal
tribunal did consider all applicant's claims in its "findings and reasons"
what the tribunal thought of information was not information for the purpose of s.424a

citances.sentence: On 31 August 2009 Lindgren J made orders allowing the appeal from this Court in SZKJT . (See Minister for Immigration & Citizenship v SZKJT [2009] FCA 984).

legistitles.title: MIGRATION ACT 1958
MIGRATION ACT 1958 - SECT 420 Refugee Review Tribunal's way of operating
MIGRATION ACT 1958 - SECT 424 Tribunal may seek information
MIGRATION ACT 1958 - SECT 424A Information and invitation given in writing by Tribunal
MIGRATION ACT 1958 - SECT 424B Requirements for written invitation etc.
MIGRATION ACT 1958 - SECT 425 Tribunal must invite applicant to appear
MIGRATION ACT 1958 - SECT 430 Refugee Review Tribunal to record its decisions etc.
MIGRATION ACT 1958 - SECT 441A Methods by which Tribunal gives documents to a person other than the Secretary
FEDERAL COURT RULES
